marketNews.title: Minister of Communication and Digital Meutya Hafid says government will set minimum age limit for social media users
marketNews.content: Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, said on Monday (13 January) that the government plans to issue regulations to set a minimum age limit for social media users, although she did not specify the exact age. The measure aims to protect children in the digital space.

marketNews.title: BOJ Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino says rate hike under discussion for January 2025
marketNews.content: Deputy Governor of the Bank of Japan, Ryozo Himino, said on Tuesday (14 January) that the central bank will discuss whether to raise interest rates in a meeting scheduled for 23-24 January 2025. Bloomberg reported that the comment indicates the BOJ has not ruled out a rate hike in the month, with most analysts expecting a move in January or March 2025.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: 2025 Guidance and Land Sale to ANTM
tickerNews.content:
Management of AKR Corporindo ($AKRA) announced its 2025 guidance: net profit is expected at approximately IDR 2.4-2.6 trillion, 4-18% YoY higher than the 2024 consensus estimate of IDR 2.2-2.3 trillion. The 2024 consensus itself is about 18-21% lower YoY than the 2023 net profit of IDR 2.8 trillion. Net profit from the fuel trading and chemical distribution segment is targeted to grow 5-7% YoY, driven by fuel demand from the mining sector and new chemical sales. Land sales in JIIPE, Gresik are targeted at about 80-110 hectares (versus 9M24 actual 32 hectares), driven by sales delayed in 2024 and recognized in 2025, such as 50 hectares from Sichuan Hebang Biotechnology Co. and 30 hectares from other clients. Utility revenue is projected to rise significantly as tenants Xinyi Glass and the normalisation of PT Freeport Indonesia’s smelter operations commence mid-2025.

In addition to the 2025 guidance, AKRA signed a land-sale agreement with Aneka Tambang ($ANTM) on 27 December 2024, although the land area and transaction value were not disclosed. According to ANTM’s Business Development Director I Dewa Wirantaya, the presence of PT Freeport Indonesia’s smelter in JIIPE will give ANTM additional benefit because the company will have direct access to 99.99% pure gold concentrate.

In a separate transaction, AKRA’s controlling shareholder PT Arthakencana Rayatama bought 1.5 million AKRA shares at an average price of IDR 1,065.4 per share on 7 and 9 January 2025. The transaction, worth roughly IDR 1.6 billion, raised PT Arthakencana Rayatama’s ownership from 63.611% to 63.619%. This is the first AKRA share purchase by the shareholder in 2025, the last accumulation having been in September 2024.

tickerNews.title: Superbank (EMTK) considering Jakarta IPO
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that PT Super Bank Indonesia (Superbank), a digital bank owned by EMTK, is considering an initial public offering on the Indonesia Stock Exchange this year. Bloomberg said Superbank is looking for several banks to execute the corporate action, targeting potential proceeds of US$200-300 million and a valuation of US$1.5-2 billion. The source added that the IPO consideration is still in early stages and details may change. Current Superbank shareholders include Elang Mahkota Teknologi (31.27% as of 30 September 2024), Grab Holdings Ltd. (NASDAQ: GRAB), Singapore Telecommunications Ltd. (SGX: Z74) and KakaoBank Corp (KRX: 323410). Head of Corporate Finance and Investor Relations, Ekaputra Aditya, said the company could not comment on rumors or speculation.

tickerNews.title: UNVR approves IDR 7 trillion ice-cream business divestment and appoints three new directors
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia shareholders on Tuesday (14 January) approved the divestiture of the ice-cream business valued at IDR 7 trillion and the appointment of three new directors. CEO Benjie Yap said the ice-cream divestment is expected to provide direct cash dividend to shareholders once the transaction is completed and will strengthen the company’s cash position. The company plans to reinforce its core businesses of personal care, beauty and wellbeing, and nutrition.

tickerNews.title: SILO to acquire First REIT’s hospital asset portfolio in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Siloam International Hospitals announced a plan to acquire the hospital-asset portfolio owned by First REIT in Indonesia. SILO is currently the existing tenant and operator of the portfolio. Transaction value was not disclosed, but the deal is said to align with the company’s expansion plan and is expected to have a positive impact on the business.

tickerNews.title: MIKA to open two new hospitals in 2025 and two groundbreaking projects for 2026
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) said it will open two new hospitals in West Java and East Java in 2025 and will break ground on two additional hospitals in the Greater Jakarta area and East Java for opening in 2026. Management did not disclose 2025 revenue or net-profit targets but is optimistic about achieving double-digit growth in 2024.

tickerNews.title: MLPT major shareholder sells 37.5 million shares, reducing stake to 84.95%
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Multipolar Technology (MLPT), Multipolar, sold 37.5 million MLPT shares at an average price of IDR 8,000 per share on 9 January 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 300 billion. After the sale, the ownership of MLPL in MLPT fell from 86.95% to 84.95%.

tickerNews.title: CLEO targets double-digit sales growth in 2025 with three new plants
tickerNews.content: Chief Executive of Sariguna Primatirta, Melisa Patricia, said the company targets double-digit sales growth in 2025. To achieve the goal, CLEO will open three new plants in Pekanbaru, Pontianak and Palu, bringing the total number of plants to 35, making CLEO the Indonesian packaged-water company with the largest plant network. The expansion will be accompanied by an increase in the distribution network, which already includes more than 380 internal distributors and over 7,000 distribution partners.

tickerNews.title: Meratus Jasa Prima shareholder sells ~9.7 million KARW shares
tickerNews.content: PT Saranakelola Investasi, the controlling shareholder of Meratus Jasa Prima (KARW), sold approximately 9.7 million KARW shares at an average price of IDR 1,325 per share on 8-9 January 2025. The transaction, worth about IDR 12.9 billion, is intended to broaden the retail investor base. After the sale, PT Saranakelola Investasi’s ownership in KARW fell from 78.68% to 77.03%.

tickerNews.title: Gajah Tunggal secures IDR 4.4 trillion new credit facility
tickerNews.content: Gajah Tunggal announced that it has drawn a new credit facility of IDR 4.4 trillion consisting of two tranches with tenors of eight and nine years from Bank Central Asia (BBCA) and five other local banks. Part of the loan will be used to pre-pay senior secured notes amounting to US$175 million that mature in 2026. The facility, fully denominated in rupiah, is intended to hedge foreign-exchange volatility and carries a lower interest rate.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia appoints former foreign-affairs minister Retno Marsudi as independent commissioner
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia shareholders on Tuesday (14 January) approved the appointment of former foreign-affairs minister (2014-2024) Retno Marsudi as an independent commissioner, replacing Raden Sukhyar.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group signs MoU with PT ZTE Indonesia for 5 MW solar project in Oecusse, Timor Leste
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group (LABA) signed a memorandum of understanding with PT ZTE Indonesia to explore photovoltaic renewable-energy projects in Oecusse, Timor Leste. The MoU follows a December 2024 power-sale agreement between LABA and the Oecusse government for a 5 MW solar plant and battery energy storage system.

tickerNews.title: Maharaksa Biru Energi shareholder buys 99.6 million OASA shares
tickerNews.content: Maharaksa Biru Energi shareholder PT Majukarya Mandiri Indonesia bought approximately 99.6 million OASA shares at an average price of IDR 137 per share on 24 December 2024. The transaction, worth about IDR 13.7 billion, raised PT Majukarya Mandiri Indonesia’s ownership in OASA from 4.12% to 5.69%.

tickerNews.title: Panorama Sentrawisata receives IDR 400 billion interim dividend
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata (PANR) received an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately IDR 400 billion from its subsidiary PT Panorama Ventura Indonesia. Part of the proceeds was used to repay a bank loan of about IDR 324 billion to Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI).

tickerNews.title: Albizia ASEAN Opportunities Fund sells 23.2 million PZZA shares
tickerNews.content: Albizia ASEAN Opportunities Fund sold approximately 23.2 million PZZA shares at an average price of IDR 203 per share on 7 January 2025. The transaction, valued at about IDR 4.7 billion, reduced the fund’s holding in PZZA from 5.56% to 4.8%.

tickerNews.title: SMMA to issue IDR 800 billion of bonds
tickerNews.content: Sinar Mas Multiartha (SMMA) plans to issue IDR 800 billion of bonds. The issue consists of Series A (IDR 100 billion, 7% coupon, 370-day tenor), Series B (IDR 500 billion, 8.25% coupon, 3-year tenor) and Series C (IDR 200 billion, 9% coupon, 5-year tenor). The bonds received an irAA rating from PT Kredit Rating Indonesia. The public offering runs on 13-14 January 2025.
